metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0485 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
S3QL 1.18.1 and earlier uses the pickle Python module unsafely, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted serialized object in (1) common.py or (2) local.py in backends/.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

s3ql - 2.10.1+dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: s3ql package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.1+dfsg-4').
